ref.pp:
/-- Definition 7.2.1 (Formal infinite series). This is similar to Chapter 6 sequence, but is
  manipulated differently. As with Chapter 5, we will start series from 0 by default.
-/
@[ext]
structure Series where
  m : ℤ
  seq : ℤ → ℝ
  vanish : ∀ n < m, seq n = 0

/-- Functions from ℕ to ℝ can be thought of as series. -/
instance instCoe : Coe (ℕ → ℝ) Series where
  coe := fun a ↦
    { m := 0
      seq n := if n ≥ 0 then a n.toNat else 0
      vanish := by grind }

signature.pp: (a : ℕ → ℝ) (n : ℕ) : (a : Series).seq n = a n

ref.pp:
@[simp]
theorem eval_coe (a : ℕ → ℝ) (n : ℕ) : (a : Series).seq n = a n := by simp

signature.pp: {m : ℤ} (a : { n // n ≥ m } → ℝ) : Series

ref.pp:
abbrev mk' {m : ℤ} (a : { n // n ≥ m } → ℝ) : Series where
  m := m
  seq n := if h : n ≥ m then a ⟨n, h⟩ else 0
  vanish := by grind

signature.pp: {m : ℤ} (a : { n // n ≥ m } → ℝ) {n : ℤ} (h : n ≥ m) : (Series.mk' a).seq n = a ⟨n, h⟩

ref.pp: theorem eval_mk' {m : ℤ} (a : { n // n ≥ m } → ℝ) {n : ℤ} (h : n ≥ m) : (Series.mk' a).seq n = a ⟨n, h⟩ := by simp [h]

/-- Definition 7.2.2 (Convergence of series) -/
abbrev «partial» (s : Series) (N : ℤ) : ℝ :=
  ∑ n ∈ Finset.Icc s.m N, s.seq n

signature.pp: (s : Series) {N : ℤ} (h : N ≥ s.m - 1) : s.partial (N + 1) = s.partial N + s.seq (N + 1)

ref.pp:
theorem partial_succ (s : Series) {N : ℤ} (h : N ≥ s.m - 1) : s.partial (N + 1) = s.partial N + s.seq (N + 1) :=
  by
  unfold Series.partial
  rw [add_comm (s.partial N) _]
  convert Finset.sum_insert (show N + 1 ∉ Finset.Icc s.m N by simp)
  symm; apply Finset.insert_Icc_right_eq_Icc_add_one; linarith

signature.pp: {s : Series} {N : ℤ} (h : N < s.m) : s.partial N = 0

ref.pp:
theorem partial_of_lt {s : Series} {N : ℤ} (h : N < s.m) : s.partial N = 0 :=
  by
  unfold Series.partial
  rw [Finset.sum_eq_zero]
  intro n hn; simp at hn; grind

abbrev convergesTo (s : Series) (L : ℝ) : Prop :=
  Filter.atTop.Tendsto (s.partial) (nhds L)

abbrev converges (s : Series) : Prop :=
  ∃ L, s.convergesTo L

abbrev diverges (s : Series) : Prop :=
  ¬s.converges

noncomputable abbrev sum (s : Series) : ℝ :=
  if h : s.converges then h.choose else 0
theorem converges_of_convergesTo {s : Series} {L : ℝ} (h : s.convergesTo L) : s.converges := by use L

signature.pp: {s : Series} {L : ℝ} (h : s.convergesTo L) : s.sum = L

ref.pp:
/-- Remark 7.2.3 -/
theorem sum_of_converges {s : Series} {L : ℝ} (h : s.convergesTo L) : s.sum = L :=
  by
  simp [sum, converges_of_convergesTo h]
  exact tendsto_nhds_unique ((converges_of_convergesTo h).choose_spec) h

signature.pp: {s : Series} {L L' : ℝ} (h : s.convergesTo L) (h' : s.convergesTo L') : L = L'

ref.pp:
theorem convergesTo_uniq {s : Series} {L L' : ℝ} (h : s.convergesTo L) (h' : s.convergesTo L') : L = L' :=
  tendsto_nhds_unique h h'
theorem convergesTo_sum {s : Series} (h : s.converges) : s.convergesTo s.sum := by simp [sum, h]; exact h.choose_spec

/-- Example 7.2.4 -/
noncomputable abbrev example_7_2_4 :=
  mk' (m := 1) (fun n ↦ (2 : ℝ) ^ (-n : ℤ))
theorem example_7_2_4a {N : ℤ} (hN : N ≥ 1) : example_7_2_4.partial N = 1 - (2 : ℝ) ^ (-N) := by sorry
theorem example_7_2_4b : example_7_2_4.convergesTo 1 := by sorry
theorem example_7_2_4c : example_7_2_4.sum = 1 := by sorry

noncomputable abbrev example_7_2_4' :=
  mk' (m := 1) (fun n ↦ (2 : ℝ) ^ (n : ℤ))
theorem example_7_2_4'a {N : ℤ} (hN : N ≥ 1) : example_7_2_4'.partial N = (2 : ℝ) ^ (N + 1) - 2 := by sorry
theorem example_7_2_4'b : example_7_2_4'.diverges := by sorry

signature.pp: (s : Series) : s.converges ↔ ∀ ε > 0, ∃ N ≥ s.m, ∀ p ≥ N, ∀ q ≥ N, |∑ n ∈ Finset.Icc p q, s.seq n| ≤ ε

ref.pp:
/-- Proposition 7.2.5 / Exercise 7.2.2 -/
theorem converges_iff_tail_decay (s : Series) :
    s.converges ↔ ∀ ε > 0, ∃ N ≥ s.m, ∀ p ≥ N, ∀ q ≥ N, |∑ n ∈ Finset.Icc p q, s.seq n| ≤ ε := by sorry

/-- Corollary 7.2.6 (Zero test) / Exercise 7.2.3 -/
theorem decay_of_converges {s : Series} (h : s.converges) : Filter.atTop.Tendsto s.seq (nhds 0) := by sorry
theorem diverges_of_nodecay {s : Series} (h : ¬Filter.atTop.Tendsto s.seq (nhds 0)) : s.diverges := by sorry

/-- Example 7.2.7 -/
theorem example_7_2_7 : ((fun n : ℕ ↦ (1 : ℝ)) : Series).diverges :=
  by
  apply diverges_of_nodecay
  sorry

theorem example_7_2_7' : ((fun n : ℕ ↦ (-1 : ℝ) ^ n) : Series).diverges :=
  by
  apply diverges_of_nodecay
  sorry

/-- Definition 7.2.8 (Absolute convergence) -/
abbrev abs (s : Series) : Series :=
  mk' (m := s.m) (fun n ↦ |s.seq n|)

abbrev absConverges (s : Series) : Prop :=
  s.abs.converges

abbrev condConverges (s : Series) : Prop :=
  s.converges ∧ ¬s.absConverges

/-- Proposition 7.2.9 (Absolute convergence test) / Example 7.2.4 -/
theorem converges_of_absConverges {s : Series} (h : s.absConverges) : s.converges := by sorry
theorem abs_le {s : Series} (h : s.absConverges) : |s.sum| ≤ s.abs.sum := by sorry

signature.pp:
{m : ℤ} {a : { n // n ≥ m } → ℝ} (ha : ∀ n, a n ≥ 0) (ha' : Antitone a) :
  ((mk' (fun n ↦ (-1) ^ (n : ℤ) * a n)).converges ↔ Filter.atTop.Tendsto a (nhds 0))

ref.pp:
/-- Proposition 7.2.12 (Alternating series test) -/
theorem converges_of_alternating {m : ℤ} {a : { n // n ≥ m } → ℝ} (ha : ∀ n, a n ≥ 0) (ha' : Antitone a) :
    ((mk' (fun n ↦ (-1) ^ (n : ℤ) * a n)).converges ↔ Filter.atTop.Tendsto a (nhds 0)) := by
  -- This proof is written to follow the structure of the original text.
  
  constructor
  . intro h; apply decay_of_converges at h
    rw [tendsto_iff_dist_tendsto_zero] at h ⊢
    rw [← Filter.tendsto_comp_val_Ici_atTop (a := m)] at h
    convert h using 2 with _ n
    simp [n.property]
  intro h
  unfold converges convergesTo
  set b := mk' fun n ↦ (-1) ^ (n : ℤ) * a n
  set S := b.partial
  have claim0 {N : ℤ} (hN : N ≥ m) : S (N + 1) = S N + (-1) ^ (N + 1) * a ⟨N + 1, by grind⟩ := by
    convert b.partial_succ ?_; simp [b, show N + 1 ≥ m by grind]; linarith
  have claim1 {N : ℤ} (hN : N ≥ m) : S (N + 2) = S N + (-1) ^ (N + 1) * (a ⟨N + 1, by grind⟩ - a ⟨N + 2, by grind⟩) :=
    calc
      S (N + 2) = S N + (-1) ^ (N + 1) * a ⟨N + 1, by grind⟩ + (-1) ^ (N + 2) * a ⟨N + 2, by grind⟩ := by
        simp_rw [← claim0 hN, show N + 2 = N + 1 + 1 by abel]; apply claim0; linarith
      _ = S N + (-1) ^ (N + 1) * a ⟨N + 1, by grind⟩ + (-1) * (-1) ^ (N + 1) * a ⟨N + 2, by grind⟩ := by congr;
        rw [← zpow_one_add₀] <;> grind
      _ = _ := by ring
  have claim2 {N : ℤ} (hN : N ≥ m) (h' : Odd N) : S (N + 2) ≥ S N := by simp [claim1 hN, h'.add_one.neg_one_zpow];
    apply ha'; simp
  have claim3 {N : ℤ} (hN : N ≥ m) (h' : Even N) : S (N + 2) ≤ S N := by simp [claim1 hN, h'.add_one.neg_one_zpow];
    apply ha'; simp
  have why1 {N : ℤ} (hN : N ≥ m) (h' : Even N) (k : ℕ) : S (N + 2 * k) ≤ S N := by sorry
  have why2 {N : ℤ} (hN : N ≥ m) (h' : Even N) (k : ℕ) : S (N + 2 * k + 1) ≥ S N - a ⟨N + 1, by grind⟩ := by sorry
  have why3 {N : ℤ} (hN : N ≥ m) (h' : Even N) (k : ℕ) : S (N + 2 * k + 1) ≤ S (N + 2 * k) := by sorry
  have claim4 {N : ℤ} (hN : N ≥ m) (h' : Even N) (k : ℕ) :
    S N - a ⟨N + 1, by grind⟩ ≤ S (N + 2 * k + 1) ∧ S (N + 2 * k + 1) ≤ S (N + 2 * k) ∧ S (N + 2 * k) ≤ S N :=
    ⟨ge_iff_le.mp (why2 hN h' k), why3 hN h' k, why1 hN h' k⟩
  have why4 {N n : ℤ} (hN : N ≥ m) (h' : Even N) (hn : n ≥ N) : S N - a ⟨N + 1, by grind⟩ ≤ S n ∧ S n ≤ S N := by sorry
  have why5 {ε : ℝ} (hε : ε > 0) : ∃ N, ∀ n ≥ N, ∀ m ≥ N, |S n - S m| ≤ ε := by sorry
  have : CauchySeq S := by
    rw [Metric.cauchySeq_iff']
    intro ε hε; choose N hN using why5 (half_pos hε); use N
    intro n hn; rw [Real.dist_eq]; linarith [hN n hn N (by simp)]
  exact cauchySeq_tendsto_of_complete this

/-- Example 7.2.13 -/
noncomputable abbrev example_7_2_13 : Series :=
  (mk' (m := 1) (fun n ↦ (-1 : ℝ) ^ (n : ℤ) / (n : ℤ)))
theorem example_7_2_13a : example_7_2_13.converges := by sorry
theorem example_7_2_13b : ¬example_7_2_13.absConverges := by sorry
theorem example_7_2_13c : example_7_2_13.condConverges := by sorry

instance inst_add : Add Series where
  add a
    b :=
    { m := max a.m b.m
      seq n := if n ≥ max a.m b.m then a.seq n + b.seq n else 0
      vanish n hn := by rw [lt_iff_not_ge] at hn; simp [hn] }

signature.pp: (a b : ℕ → ℝ) : (a : Series) + (b : Series) = (fun n ↦ a n + b n)

ref.pp:
theorem add_coe (a b : ℕ → ℝ) : (a : Series) + (b : Series) = (fun n ↦ a n + b n) :=
  by
  ext n; rfl
  by_cases h : n ≥ 0 <;> simp [h, HAdd.hAdd, Add.add]

signature.pp: {s t : Series} {L M : ℝ} (hs : s.convergesTo L) (ht : t.convergesTo M) : (s + t).convergesTo (L + M)

ref.pp:
/--
Proposition 7.2.14 (a) (Series laws) / Exercise 7.2.5.  The `convergesTo` form can be more convenient for applications. -/
theorem add {s t : Series} {L M : ℝ} (hs : s.convergesTo L) (ht : t.convergesTo M) : (s + t).convergesTo (L + M) := by
  sorry

signature.pp: {s t : Series} (hs : s.converges) (ht : t.converges) : (s + t).converges ∧ (s + t).sum = s.sum + t.sum

ref.pp:
theorem add {s t : Series} (hs : s.converges) (ht : t.converges) : (s + t).converges ∧ (s + t).sum = s.sum + t.sum := by
  sorry

instance smul : SMul ℝ Series where
  smul c
    s :=
    { m := s.m
      seq n := if n ≥ s.m then c * s.seq n else 0
      vanish := by grind }

signature.pp: (a : ℕ → ℝ) (c : ℝ) : (c • a : Series) = (fun n ↦ c * a n)

ref.pp:
theorem smul_coe (a : ℕ → ℝ) (c : ℝ) : (c • a : Series) = (fun n ↦ c * a n) :=
  by
  ext n; rfl
  by_cases h : n ≥ 0 <;> simp [h, HSMul.hSMul, SMul.smul]

signature.pp: {s : Series} {L c : ℝ} (hs : s.convergesTo L) : (c • s).convergesTo (c * L)

ref.pp:
/--
Proposition 7.2.14 (b) (Series laws) / Exercise 7.2.5.  The `convergesTo` form can be more convenient for applications. -/
theorem smul {s : Series} {L c : ℝ} (hs : s.convergesTo L) : (c • s).convergesTo (c * L) := by sorry

signature.pp: {c : ℝ} {s : Series} (hs : s.converges) : (c • s).converges ∧ (c • s).sum = c * s.sum

ref.pp: theorem smul {c : ℝ} {s : Series} (hs : s.converges) : (c • s).converges ∧ (c • s).sum = c * s.sum := by sorry

/--
The corresponding API for subtraction was not in the textbook, but is useful in later sections, so is included here. -/
instance inst_sub : Sub Series where
  sub a
    b :=
    { m := max a.m b.m
      seq n := if n ≥ max a.m b.m then a.seq n - b.seq n else 0
      vanish := by grind }

signature.pp: (a b : ℕ → ℝ) : (a : Series) - (b : Series) = (fun n ↦ a n - b n)

ref.pp:
theorem sub_coe (a b : ℕ → ℝ) : (a : Series) - (b : Series) = (fun n ↦ a n - b n) :=
  by
  ext n; rfl
  by_cases h : n ≥ 0 <;> simp [h, HSub.hSub, Sub.sub]

signature.pp: {s t : Series} {L M : ℝ} (hs : s.convergesTo L) (ht : t.convergesTo M) : (s - t).convergesTo (L - M)

ref.pp:
theorem sub {s t : Series} {L M : ℝ} (hs : s.convergesTo L) (ht : t.convergesTo M) : (s - t).convergesTo (L - M) := by
  sorry

signature.pp: {s t : Series} (hs : s.converges) (ht : t.converges) : (s - t).converges ∧ (s - t).sum = s.sum - t.sum

ref.pp:
theorem sub {s t : Series} (hs : s.converges) (ht : t.converges) : (s - t).converges ∧ (s - t).sum = s.sum - t.sum := by
  sorry

abbrev «from» (s : Series) (m₁ : ℤ) : Series :=
  mk' (m := max s.m m₁) (fun n ↦ s.seq (n : ℤ))

/-- Proposition 7.2.14 (c) (Series laws) / Exercise 7.2.5 -/
theorem converges_from (s : Series) (k : ℕ) : s.converges ↔ (s.from (s.m + k)).converges := by sorry

signature.pp: {s : Series} (k : ℕ) (h : s.converges) : s.sum = ∑ n ∈ Finset.Ico s.m (s.m + k), s.seq n + (s.from (s.m + k)).sum

ref.pp:
theorem sum_from {s : Series} (k : ℕ) (h : s.converges) :
    s.sum = ∑ n ∈ Finset.Ico s.m (s.m + k), s.seq n + (s.from (s.m + k)).sum := by sorry

signature.pp: {s : Series} {x : ℝ} (h : s.convergesTo x) (L : ℤ) : (mk' (m := s.m + L) (fun n ↦ s.seq (n - L))).convergesTo x

ref.pp:
/-- Proposition 7.2.14 (d) (Series laws) / Exercise 7.2.5 -/
theorem shift {s : Series} {x : ℝ} (h : s.convergesTo x) (L : ℤ) :
    (mk' (m := s.m + L) (fun n ↦ s.seq (n - L))).convergesTo x := by sorry

signature.pp: {a : ℕ → ℝ} (ha : Filter.atTop.Tendsto a (nhds 0)) : ((fun n : ℕ ↦ a (n + 1) - a n) : Series).convergesTo (a 0)

ref.pp:
/-- Lemma 7.2.15 (telescoping series) / Exercise 7.2.6 -/
theorem telescope {a : ℕ → ℝ} (ha : Filter.atTop.Tendsto a (nhds 0)) :
    ((fun n : ℕ ↦ a (n + 1) - a n) : Series).convergesTo (a 0) := by
  sorry
